page.title: 14PRESERVED WOODLAND
page.content: The{woods}are especially beautiful in spring when there is a carpet of bluebells and primroses. Years ago people used to visit the woods but they are{not open to the public}now because people brought dogs which killed the wild life, and some people even started digging up wild flowers. There are a few{deer}in the woods but they can destroy crops and damage trees so the farmers do not like them, also the{foxhunters}dislike deer because the hounds chase them instead of the foxes. In the winter there is quite a lot of {industry}in the woods. The farmer cuts firewood, fencing posts, bean poles and peasticks.{Thatchers}come from Chelmsford and Nayland to cut hazel twigs to make bauches to hold the thatch in place, and to make the attractive patterns on thatched roofs.
